f7725138-d7ba-4fba-87d9-e6a1b8ee562b.description: Learners have worked through an intensive four-course, 105-hour pre-apprenticeship program focusing on computer science basics, IBM Z Explore, z/OS commands, and system programming in preparation for an IBM Z apprenticeship program. Earners of the IBM Z Pre-Apprenticeship badge have satisfied multiple skill sets in Z Xplore concepts, professional skills, and enterprise design thinking.
f7725138-d7ba-4fba-87d9-e6a1b8ee562b.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - IBM Z

alignments.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - IBM Z
alignments.description: This Pre-Apprenticeship program has been designed to prepare individuals for an IBM Z apprenticeship program. It includes both technical and professional skills components which provide a solid introduction to a rewarding career in IBM Z Mainframe technologies.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed a 50-hour, self-paced IBM Z Xplore program. Passed all relevant assessments to understand z/OS commands, mainframe systems, and computer programming principles.
Completed a comprehensive curriculum in AP Computer Science principles offered by Khan Academy. Topics include algorithms, data analysis, digital information, and online data security.

Learners attended weekly sessions with an IBM Z Subject Matter Expert. The one-hour, once-per-week sessions cover multiple components of the IBM Z Xplore architecture, coding principles, and enterprise concepts that validate coursework and necessary training for the pre-apprenticeship program.

Learners worked with a Professional Success Coach to develop their professional skills in weekly group meetings, with a focus on communications, problem solving, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.

9d797e89-bf71-4e1d-8beb-33819f03d59b.description: The Network Engineer Pre-Apprenticeship program is an eight-week live classroom series that introduces new IT professionals to the intricacies of networking concepts, network infrastructure, network operations network security, and network troubleshooting. Learners have been introduced to various components of IT networks that range from operation policies and procedures, migration techniques, and network topologies.
9d797e89-bf71-4e1d-8beb-33819f03d59b.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Network Engineer

alignments.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Network Engineer
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal-level qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the Network Engineer pre-apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Network Engineer Pre-Apprentices will work through an intensive eight-week curriculum with our partnered organization, Intequal. Areas of the curriculum will include routing and switching, IP addressing, remote access, and an introduction to the Network Engineer career path.

Learners have attended weekly coaching sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Professional Success Coaches cover various soft skills in problem-solving, leadership, time management, conflict resolution, and effective communication.

At the end of the Network Engineer curriculum, Pre-Apprentices will take a comprehensive examination to ensure their understanding of each module completed with Intequal. Once a passing score is achieved, pre-apprentices are prepared to meet with the Recruiting team for potential placement into Network Engineer apprenticeship programs with external employers.

cccc6103-b190-4020-b464-896096f3f076.description: Learners have completed an intensive 90+ hour foundational cybersecurity course to prepare them to be successful in a cybersecurity apprenticeship. They have developed foundational competencies in cybersecurity operating systems security, compliance frameworks, database vulnerabilities, and the basics of Agile methodologies. They have also developed professional skills including communications, problem-solving and critical thinking.
cccc6103-b190-4020-b464-896096f3f076.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Cybersecurity

alignments.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Cybersecurity
alignments.description: Franklin's Cybersecurity Pre-Apprenticeship provides the foundational knowledge for learners to succeed in Franklin's Cybersecurity Apprenticeship, which is a Registered Apprenticeship Program with the U.S. Department of Labor.

badge_template_activities.title: Learners attended six weekly Subject Matter Expert sessions to build their understanding of cybersecurity environments. They learned current cybersecurity best practices from real-world scenarios.
Learners attended Group Success Coaching sessions to build essential professional skills which are critical to success in an information technology environment.
The technical content of this program combines the basics of cybersecurity and fundamental Agile processes and procedures.

f406c80e-ba38-49a0-975d-de77bd26b895.description: Earners learn the necessity of managing time in the workplace to meet organizational needs. Learners will organize priorities and plan how to allocate time commitments that meet the demands of their professional and personal goals. They understand the importance of punctuality to work and to meetings, effective calendar management, and critical task time allocation fundamentals.
f406c80e-ba38-49a0-975d-de77bd26b895.name: Introduction to Time Management

badge_template_activities.title: Review videos and articles covering techniques of time management and assess one's level of planning and prioritization effectiveness.
Attend the selected keynote speaker presentation on Introduction to Time Management. Answer selected questions from the presentation and discuss the results with your Success Coach.

Demonstrate the ability to manage one's own work calendar to meet the daily cadence in the workplace. Examples can include timeliness to work meetings, Success Coach meetings, and allocating time for critical tasks.

3eeaa313-66bf-4767-b4c8-1c0a41463bfd.description: Earners learn how to create professional career plans that acclimate to their desired outcome in their professional practice. Learners will demonstrate proper career plan development with a 24-month plan. The career planning helps the individual assess their own skills, potential, strengths that ensure success in their profession.
3eeaa313-66bf-4767-b4c8-1c0a41463bfd.name: Career and Professional Development Planning

badge_template_activities.title: Review videos and articles covering career development in your professional context. Provide examples of career planning as it relates to an apprentice's personal strengths and opportunities to ensure alignment with organizational objectives.

Develop a framework with your Coach at the beginning of the apprenticeship and utilize that assessment to judge the progress towards career goals. Adjust plan throughout the apprenticeship program to meet the needs of the individual/organization.
Generate a 24-month plan with your coach that outlines short and long-term goals that are relevant to your professional development.

62d96437-3801-4c8d-8e6a-380d23f2d816.description: Earners learn the foundational concepts of leadership in the workplace. They understand how to drive hard conversations, be aware of their actions in the workplace, and highlight key components to leadership.
62d96437-3801-4c8d-8e6a-380d23f2d816.name: Introduction to Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Read relevant articles and watch pertinent videos on leadership assigned by your Success Coach.
Attend the selected keynote speaker presentation on Introduction to Leadership. Answer selected questions from the presentation and discuss the results with your Success Coach.

Successfully passed Franklin Apprenticeships assessments that confirmed a full review of each task's relevant resources and completion. In addition, learners will demonstrate driving hard and honest conversations, asking for help on the job, and celebrating the success of others in the workplace.

82bd78b8-4ccd-47fc-9e01-12de7272fed6.description: Earners learn the basic concepts of breaking down complex work tasks utilizing online and professional resources to accomplish work deliverables. Learners show competencies in analyzing the issue, understanding others' interests, providing possible solutions, and evaluate/select the best option. They demonstrate the basic components of issue resolution with their mentors and managers in an organization.
82bd78b8-4ccd-47fc-9e01-12de7272fed6.name: Introduction to Problem-Solving

badge_template_activities.title: Review videos and articles covering techniques of problem-solving and discuss the learning experience with your coach.
Attend the selected keynote speaker presentation on Introduction to Problem Solving. Answer selected questions from the presentation and discuss the results with your Success Coach.

Bring a real-world problem to your coach with a solution that fits the requirements of your organization. Demonstrate the ability to take a technical problem and utilize the key components to effective problem-solving to bring resolution to the issue at hand.

skills.name: Critical Thinking And Problem Solving Skills

19b66a21-13bc-4b3e-ab69-6c83052f3212.description: Earners learn the mediation strategies in high-stress work situations and provide solutions to the task at hand. Learners demonstrate openness to mitigating conflict in the workplace using various methods. The learner will demonstrate how to communicate a difficult conversation in their organization, listen carefully to their coworkers to seek resolution, and develop a plan to work through the conflict in real-time.
19b66a21-13bc-4b3e-ab69-6c83052f3212.name: Introduction to Conflict Resolution

badge_template_activities.title: Review videos and articles covering techniques of strong conflict resolution and assess which methods are most useful in one's professional context.
Attend the selected keynote speaker presentation on Introduction to Conflict Resolution. Answer selected questions from the presentation and discuss the results with your Success Coach.
Demonstrate understanding of a real-world professional problem with a resolution that meets the requirements of your coach, manager, and mentor.

d9eb4381-2248-4f6d-a0bd-d569ff70c866.description: Earners learn how to communicate clearly and effectively with others. They understand how to set expectations, work with a team, listen, support clients, and clarify written and verbal communication. Areas of knowledge development for the learner will be encoding the information received from the speaker, decoding the expectation accurately, and providing feedback and meaningful response that contributes to the organization's overall mission.
d9eb4381-2248-4f6d-a0bd-d569ff70c866.name: Introduction to Effective Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Review videos and articles covering techniques of strong communication and assess one's personal communication style.
Attend the selected keynote speaker presentation on Introduction to Effective Communication. Answer selected questions from the presentation and discuss the results with your Success Coach.

Successfully passed Franklin Apprenticeships assessments that confirmed a full review of each task's relevant resources and completion. Learners will showcase their ability to clarify work instructions using probing questions that enhance internal collaboration with their peers.

2321cf9e-f26e-441d-9cf9-5c42898077f6.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 12-month training program including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in an IBMz Mainframe Administrator capacity, 320 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, and weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Graduates possess a solid knowledge of IBMz Mainframe system processes with competencies in CICS operations, IMS, IBM z/OS communications, and SYSMOD operations.
2321cf9e-f26e-441d-9cf9-5c42898077f6.name: IBMz Mainframe System Administrator Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - IBMz Mainframe Systems Administrator
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the IBMz Mainframe Systems Administrator apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed up to 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.
Completed 320 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Courses include Master the Mainframe 1-3, REXX Programming, IBM z/OS Structures, and SYSMOD/extended SMP.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations that align with the Mainframe requirements outlined with their employer.

1b4e7fd7-d9a1-4e1d-a4d1-691cb72d56ed.description: This credential recognizes individuals who are active champions of professional apprenticeships, in collaboration with Franklin. Even though apprenticeships change lives and transform talent pipelines, they are still relatively unknown in the United States. This credential recognizes individuals who are helping to change that by actively championing the power of apprenticeships, and contributing to unlocking the potential of the American economy.
1b4e7fd7-d9a1-4e1d-a4d1-691cb72d56ed.name: Apprenticeship Champion

badge_template_activities.title: As there are a variety of ways to raise awareness of apprenticeships, this credential can be earned by: speaking at events, writing articles, sharing personal and professional stories, participating in case studies, speaking with journalists, posting on social media, advocating for apprenticeship programs at your company, and supporting candidates through their apprenticeship journeys.

d9cbbf1c-cebc-4422-9a94-2cc2b65261e7.description: Earners of the Software Engineer Pre-Apprenticeship badge have completed the intensive four-course, 90+ hour curriculum in preparation for an apprenticeship opportunity with an employer. Software engineer Pre-Apprentices have covered Java and Python programming, Agile methodologies, enterprise design thinking, and IBM new collar professional skills.
d9cbbf1c-cebc-4422-9a94-2cc2b65261e7.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Software Engineer

alignments.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - Software Engineer
alignments.description: This Pre-Apprenticeship provides the foundational knowledge and skills for learners to be successful in a Franklin Software Engineering Apprenticeships, a Registered Apprenticeship Program with the U.S. Department of Labor.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have worked through a technical foundations course in software engineering. Competencies include Python/Java programming, SDKs, APIs, coding fundamentals, and integrations.
Learners attended group coaching sessions with Franklin Professional Success Coaches to develop their professional skills for an enterprise IT environment.

e06e0386-9c55-40dd-b66e-4006cc393c02.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 12-month training program including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in an IBMz Application Developer capacity, 290 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, and weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Graduates possess a solid knowledge of agile practices, software engineering fundamentals, DevOps, and cloud computing platorms, services, and solutions.
e06e0386-9c55-40dd-b66e-4006cc393c02.name: IBMz Mainframe Application Developer Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - IBMz Application Developer
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the IBMz Application Developer apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.

Completed 290 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Courses include Agile operations, big data and analytics, COBOL and web development fundamentals, DevOps tools and delivery practices, and cloud computing basics.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations that align with the IBMz Application Developer requirements outlined with their employer.

d361936e-815a-484b-8291-e38c1b14e326.description: Earners gained skills to enhance their ability to speak and present ideas clearly in front of a live or virtual audience.
d361936e-815a-484b-8291-e38c1b14e326.name: Presentation Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Reviewed multiple articles and videos on keys to public speaking. Delivered mock presentations to a live coaching audience for feedback.
Presented on multiple topics -- both personal and professional -- demonstrating critical thinking, professional presence, and incorporation of coach feedback.
Reflected on the importance of presentation skills and speaking skills in their career. Assessed current ability level and areas of improvement.

68813443-0b8a-454b-a315-dcf44bb3403b.description: Learners will work through an 80-hour Pre-Apprenticeship in preparation for an Apprenticeship opportunity in IT Support. The earner of the IT Support Specialist Pre-Apprenticeship badge has worked through IT support fundamentals, enterprise design thinking, and interpersonal skills that align with the competencies of IT employers.
68813443-0b8a-454b-a315-dcf44bb3403b.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - IT Support Specialist

alignments.name: Pre-Apprenticeship - IT Support Specialist
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal-level qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the IT Support Specialist Pre-Apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: IT Support Specialist pre-apprentices will attend weekly coaching sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Professional Success Coach sessions cover various topics, such as resume preparation, interview skills, time management, conflict resolution, and effective communication.

IT Support Specialist Pre-Apprentices will work through an intensive 80-hour curriculum. Areas of the curriculum will include IT support fundamentals, IBM new collar skills, enterprise design thinking, and the essentials of Agile methodology.
At the end of the IT Support Specialist curriculum, Pre-Apprentices will take a comprehensive examination to ensure their understanding of each module completed.

62aea229-5a1c-45a4-90f5-30106f55e7be.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 12-month training program including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in a Cybersecurity capacity, 144 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, and weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Graduates possess a solid knowledge of Cybersecurity best practices and are ready to take on incident response processes and database/remediation scans in a live environment.
62aea229-5a1c-45a4-90f5-30106f55e7be.name: Cybersecurity Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - Cybersecurity
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the Cybersecurity apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.
Completed 144 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Passed virtual instruction with nationally-recognized technology partners.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations that align with the Cybersecurity requirements outlined with their employer.

d0e6ff5d-1950-44d1-b06c-a4e6b2fadca0.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 12-month training program including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in a Help Desk capacity, 144 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach, and subject-matter expert sessions. As a result, graduates possess a solid knowledge of Help Desk best practices and are prepared to conduct Tier 1 responsibilities for their respected organization.
d0e6ff5d-1950-44d1-b06c-a4e6b2fadca0.name: Help Desk Technician Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - Help Desk Technician
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the Help Desk Technician apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.
Completed 144 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Passed virtual instruction with nationally-recognized technology partners.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations including Microsoft, CompTIA, and others.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.

094d7ba8-c6c1-43c1-9c96-9250da47d209.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 12-month training program, including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in an IBMz Mainframe Administrator Level 2 capacity, 221 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, and weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Graduates possess a solid knowledge of IBMz Mainframe system processes with competencies in IMS Foundations, IBM Enterprise formats, and IBM z/OS New Mainframe fundamentals.
094d7ba8-c6c1-43c1-9c96-9250da47d209.name: IBMz Mainframe System Administrator Level 2 Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - IBMz Mainframe Systems Administrator Level 2
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the IBMz Mainframe Systems Administrator Level 2 apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.

Completed 221 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Courses include IMS Foundations, Mainframe Z automation, Root Cause Analysis Training, Zowe Fundamentals, and z/OS Performance Management using RMF and WLM.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations that align with the IBMz Mainframe Level 2 requirements outlined with their employer.

9cd3647c-beec-4a7e-839f-705ba88b4bef.description: A graduate has completed an intensive 18-month training program including paid on-the-job training as a full-time employee working in a Network Engineer capacity, 144 hours of online instructor-led classroom training, and weekly professional development sessions with a Professional Success Coach. Graduates possess a solid knowledge of Network Engineer best practices and are ready to take on cloud-based and in-the-field network projects and fixes in a live environment.
9cd3647c-beec-4a7e-839f-705ba88b4bef.name: Network Engineer Apprentice

alignments.name: Registered Apprenticeship - Network Engineer
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal and State-level apprenticeship qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the Network Engineer apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 2,000 hours of on-the-job training that includes weekly Success Coach meetings, mentor/manager progress checks, and quarterly review boards with the apprentice's executive-level staff.
Completed 144 hours of technical instruction with a subject-matter expert. Passed virtual instruction with nationally-recognized technology partners.

Worked through 50 hours of professional development experience in leadership, time management, effective communication, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and career planning with a Success Coach to enhance personal and professional achievement.
Passed formal technical certification exams from leading training organizations including Microsoft, CompTIA, and others.

d9495463-cec2-421a-98f5-a86f60d70552.description: The Network Engineer Pre-Apprenticeship program is an eight-week series that introduces early career IT professionals to the intricacies of networking concepts and network infrastructure, operations, security, and troubleshooting. The program prepares learners to sit for an industry standard certificate by covering various components of IT networks that range from operation policies and procedures, migration techniques, and network topologies.
d9495463-cec2-421a-98f5-a86f60d70552.name: Network Engineer Pre-Apprenticeship

alignments.name: Network Engineer Pre-Apprenticeship
alignments.description: Franklin Apprenticeships has Federal-level qualifications that enable the successful delivery of the Network Engineer pre-apprenticeship.

badge_template_activities.title: Network Engineer Pre-Apprentices will work through an intensive eight-week curriculum. Areas of the curriculum will include routing and switching, IP addressing, remote access, and an introduction to the Network Engineer career path.

Learners have received professional skills development training in areas of resume and interview preparation, career resources, and professional etiquette through live coaching sessions. In addition, foundational training on agile methodology, design thinking, and job application essentials through self-paced learning.

At the end of the Network Engineer curriculum, Pre-Apprentices will be ready to take a comprehensive industry standard examination to ensure their understanding of the curriculum. Upon completion of the pre-apprenticeship, learners are prepared for potential placement into Network Engineer apprenticeship programs with employers.
